October 14, 1924.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Thank you most sincerely for your letter of October 4th,
and the valuable suggestions it contains.

I shall look up the Journals in which the articles to
which you refer appear. If you should find the carbons of the papers
by yourself and LePrince which you sent to Doctor Deeks, I shall be
very glad to read them.

The meeting will not be a success unless you are present.
I sincerely trust you are going to be able to reconsider the matter
and find it practicable to attend.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, John A. Ferrell- Doctor H. A. Carter,
2122 California Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
